1.title: Twitch Recap 2024
1.description: The Official Chat Badge of the Year. It takes hard work and KomodoHype to receive it. You should be proud to tell everyone you know about this.

message.body: Yooo @xhf01x
5 raiders from TheBiob have joined!
gl easiest puzzle
you mean only way of rewinding?
well in any good emulator (like snes9x rr 1.43) it's the only way :)
imagine having rewinds but then them not working on movies
which is arguably the most important mode to rewind in
but fair
it's an easy puzzle.
can't wait to see the full movie having everything up until room 1 optimized and then falling apart because we still don't have a clear plan for everything right?
Hi @dacin FutureMan FutureMan
good evening redseven77
Time to see how much you've figured out.
I hope you do the Magikey route so I can learn the weird glitches that I skipped...
there was a plan like 5 streams ago, kind of
moving coins :) :)
(not to be confused with coin snakes)
asm nobody needs: holding L stops sprites from moving horizontally, holding R stops sprites from moving vertically.
poor coin, nobody cares about it
if this was a biob level, you might get an achievement for caring about the coin.
lol
was it +p-switch
right
did you ever actually get the key?
completely forgot about that then
i only remembered that using the wing block alone didn't work out
a potentially 30 minute long second
of course you do
have you tried adding screen scrolls into the mix?
but it's optimal...
it's not actually required in armageddon right?
huh
but the frames /o\
oh i thought you said it's marginally better but I guess you meant the normal pause then
right
makes sense
i definitely had a macro when i did it in Kruela 2
the hardest part about using Bizhawk's macro tool is remembering how that thing works.
with winRAR you can just modify the files.
Also, you can get some funny effects if you copy inputs between Bizhawk movies that use different controller settings.
Such as a movie where you can edit the existing inputs, but not add inputs to the end of the movie.
Bizhawk on Linux is... ...an adventure.
how
Is that a linux thing or a recent Bizhawk version thing?
i mean we can just blame windows anyway but
I had to look at a movie file in an old Bizhawk version and WOW are the rewinds slow.
o/ HF, gl puzzling bux88Kuso
what a shame OpieOP
oh yeah
i vaguely remember that
i remember you jamming things into that corner, I forgot that it got you anywhere
there's a reason the clear video is long...
or so I've heard, I haven't seen it
i actually don't think i even saw the video show up at all, I don't even know how long it is
should something be happening
oh!
oh neat you got the key.
the video just stopped
audio still played normally though
no you were like, still at the pipe while talking about pausing
i think it was only on my end
We need Berge with blinking eyes so you we can tell that the video is working.
blinkende berge can be the tier 3 emote
at what point do we want a lua script for pausing things around?
also, what are we pausing the block around for this time?
Pit of Pausing Patterns Kapp
asm nobody needs: the pause and unpause cooldown is random.
winged blocks is only periodic after two back and forths.
can't wait for the block to wanter off to the top-left because the pattern is wrong Kapp
why pay attention if you can get distracted by chat 3Mond
I still want to see that block wander off to the top-left.
"sprites just walk away if you pause more than 10 times" sounds like asm nobody needs.
there's a lot of asm nobody needs today
but are you moving at the optimal angle?
but think of the frames.
it's all good, we made up for everything by 37 speeding the intro room
but we already lost frames by not adding scrolling to this.
Bizhawk has this neat feature where it swaps the movie file in RAM with the movie file on disk.
so how's the weather
pretty much same over here
so the plan is to get it all the way down to the yoshi right?
i was about to say you can just move over there then
but then i remembered you aren't using macros
conankun88
played a good avoidance today, pretty alright
spend most of my day at work writing a source generator as well so that was fun
it is pretty much what it says. an extension of the compiler that generates source code
i got annoyed at all the boiler plate I had to maintain so I just made it generate it instead
What the fuck are you doing
I just caught the stream did you pause that thing all the way over there
it provides an api to look at the syntax trees as well as methods to add additional files to the compilation
This hack is so easy it plays itself
we have almost reached the part where we'll run into problems most likely!
I missed the good part
Now I gotta watch hf actually play the game
you missed HF pausing the block around to get the key.
Do you think it's better than reading code?
i'm sure i've had it open before
perfectly mistimed
today on hf's stream: ranking numbers by how fake they sound
you just gotta love winged blocks
horray we did the easy part of the route
I gtg, have a good night.
it's to hope we don't have to get the baby yoshi with the block again
yeah but that also mean you can't get two baby yoshi's
with wich yoshi?
there's a no yoshi intro
it'll be fiiiinnne
no p-switch intro sounds like asm nobody needs
mhm
true
sounds like something that'd fit in this stream
Iâ€™d be disappointed if you came up with something sensible at this point
This puzzle isn't sensible that's the thing
clearly it's +1 springboard
that is fair
disappointing
gotta keep the viewers engaged after that 15 minute pause section
This hack will have 3 clear videos and they'll all somehow be very different
Haha, yeah, pause strats
My video is very unoptimized tbf
By very unoptimized i mean that i did not bother at all i just wanted to beat the level
To be fair
My way of getting yoshi is way faster
the thing i remember passing through was the cloud
well if we're missing a way to kill a reznor later...
HF HeyGuys
I come to start at hitboxes
stare*
are you manipulating the sprite number of the flying block?
ahh
yeah x pos
LUL
huzzah
beautiful
If it's possible
It's like a metaphor for life
peak gameplay
Day by day small things happen but if you look over the years you notice everything changed
Truly the hack of all time
i still want to make a clear video of that one kruela 2 level uncut
which would be an hour of that except occasionally I clip through a wall
classic
Forgetting the solution is great, now you have a hack to play
The good thing about this level is that even if you beat it in the first room you still need to play through it all for the secret exit
Isn't the solution for this the slot 3 yoshi
i don't remember what i did here
You get into the door by killing a yoshi while riding an invisible one?
I don't need to. I already beat this level
Eat canceled item?
has anyone done this intended yet?
Honestly kastelo #2 and #3 were way WAY easier than the other levels from their respective worlds idk if that's just me
this one hurt my brain a bit
I blame myself for not knowing anything about item memory when playing this
The translucent cave secret exit was one of the hardest for me
This level is fun i forgive it
free but fun
If i replay this hack I'll do the intended strat now that i know how the glitch works
Just for you
Ride up through the invisible blocks
This one is a fun one
Stunned spiny to dupe the block
It's a great idea
okay so i looked up what i did and apparently I had two yoshis with, sitting on an invisible one and pressing the p-switch so the visible one falls off-screen
was that where you deflect the boo stream so it goes up?
See yea later @xhf01x
I didn't see it looking through the video but I thought I did that
i only skimmed through it
and yes I have most of my streams, but pre 2024 is only on my external hard drive and not public
i mean most of the other things are fangames so yeah
Honestly one of my favorite things in kruela 2
Now you just spawn a goal tape a beat the level!
Oh yeah that just happens
Intended by the devs
i unfortunately do not
there is a platform yoshification setup, i can't say i remember that particularity happening
i'd like to think i'd remember if it was intended
gotta love multi room puzzles just jumping around rooms with the wrong items
that might've happened
... a couple times
there are a couple of things happening there
in the intended solution at least
that is one of the reasons
actually wait i said "that is one of the reasons" but I think that's exactly not one of the reasons
it was actually to cancel the dead yoshi's tongue, warping to screen A or so was a side effect i didn't consider
the other reason was to spit fire
there was a cut off section you wanted an eat-cancelled p-switch in
that you couldn't reach in time by just dropping the yoshi in lava and walking around
it might just be that it's because there's another alive yoshi
but isn't the point of yoshification that you "sit" on the non-yoshi yoshi?
yeah but my point being that due to that you always set the 187A flag
it's a valid tangent
from what I can tell, 187A is only reset at 0180C3 which is run when 18DF (current yoshi slot) is 0, which won't be the case as long as there's another yoshi
well not only but
it certainly sounds
i'm not quite sure I understood how the initial yoshification is set up but i'll trust you od
ah off-screening it like that
right i just missed the slot 1 part
that makes sense then
let's hope the spawn/despawn framerules line up
o/
o/
